definition: to come to sb's door/to call on sb
to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)
surname Men

sentences.english: And when exactly did the police turn up?
sentences.chinese: 警察什麼時候會找上門？

sentences.english: " he asked his daughter. "When adversity knocks on your door, how do you respond?
sentences.chinese: 他問女兒，“當逆境找上門來時，你該如何反應呢？

sentences.english: Don't just stay at home and expect a good job to come to you.
sentences.chinese: 不要只是呆在家裏，指望好工作會找上門來。

sentences.english: Save time and effort by having the movers come to you.
sentences.chinese: 讓搬運公司的人自動找上門來可以省時省力。

sentences.english: Didnt think the past enemies come to kill her family.
sentences.chinese: 沒想到過去的仇人找上門來要置霍家於死地。

sentences.english: A man does not seek his luck, luck seeks its man.
sentences.chinese: 好運是自己找上門來的。

sentences.english: I preferred the former, but there were no obvious opportunities to do so knocking on my door.
sentences.chinese: 我更希望前者，可是，沒有明顯的機會找上門來。

sentences.english: But recently the very things which she had tried to get free from so well have begun to catch up with her.
sentences.chinese: 但是最近，她曾經一直儘量遠離的東西開始找上門來。

sentences.english: But Valentine would secretly marry young men that came to him.
sentences.chinese: 但是瓦倫廷祕密地爲找上門的年輕人證婚。

sentences.english: Opportunity rarely knocks on your door.
sentences.chinese: 機會很少主動找上門來。

sentences.english: Early this year, many people will take the initiative to come to.
sentences.chinese: 今年初開始，會有很多人主動找上門來。

sentences.english: But when the taxman comes to the door.
Once again, the black widow is back.
sentences.chinese: 我們的黑寡婦又找上門了。

definition: to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to stop/to obstruct
lit. change to more severe (idiom); to become more intense (esp. of shortcoming)/to aggravate/to intensify
to set about (a task)/to hit/to punch/to touch
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
to return/to go back
to covet/envious/jealous/green with envy/infuriated/furious
to penetrate/to see through
to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
(saying) to be very scared and on edge
to look for trouble
unpleasant talk/malicious words
to ask about/to make some inquiries/to ask around
to drive out/to turn back
to seize an opportunity/to take advantage of situation
to incite disharmony/to instigate
